"Pochonbo Torch Cup" sports tournament opens 
    hyesan, June 4 (KCNA) -- The "Pochonbo Torch Cup" sports tournament was opened on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the victory in the historic Pochonbo battle.
 The tournament will include more than 30 events including football, basketball, table-tennis, marathon race, shooting. The tournament will be held in Pyongyang, Hyesan and other places till late June.    
 An opening ceremony was held at the Hyesan Stadium in Ryanggang Province today.

articles.content:
Foreign diplomats help Korean farmers 
    Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK Do Thi Hoa and embassy officials, Cuban ambassador Esteban Lobaina Romero and embassy officials and Pakistani ambassador Sultan Habib and embassy officials respectively helped the farmers of the Korea-Vietnam Friendship Jamjin Cooperative Farm, the Korea-Cuba Friendship Hwasong Cooperative Farm and the Korea-Pakistan Friendship Taesong Cooperative Farm in their rice-seedling plucking and rice transplanting.
 During the break the guests talked with farmers, deepening the feelings of friendship.  &nbp; 
 Vietnamese guests handed over aid materials to the farm.

articles.content:
World Day of Environment observed
    Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Papers here today run signed articles on the occasion of the World Day of Environment.
 Rodong Sinmun says that global warming presents itself as an important issue in the work for protecting global environment and guaranteeing the human existence and development.    
 The DPRK has made many successes in the work for preventing pollution and big progress in the protecting people's lives and promoting their health thanks to nationwide efforts under the state and social care, the paper says, and goes on: 
 Various activities and functions are taking place in the DPRK for environmental protection on this day. The DPRK will as always vigorously push ahead with the work for environmental protection, an important issue common to mankind, developing contacts and cooperation with international organizations.

articles.content:
Greetings to Hungarian PM and FM
    Pyongyang, June 5 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Peter Medgiessy upon his appointment as prime minister of Hungary.
 In the belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, it wished him success in his responsible work.    
 Meanwhile, foreign minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Laszlo Kovach upon his appointment as foreign minister of Hungary.
